unit_learning_outcomes.description: express nuanced understandings of how language and culture interact, and evidence ability to apply language to solving real-word tasks.

show awareness of differences and similarities between language use in their native language or culture and the target language or culture, as well as thoughtful understandings of how to negotiate difficulties that arise during cross-cultural and/or cross-linguistic interactions
increase their ability to clearly express, detail, defend, and/or promote ideas in public situations, through their native language and/or target language

skilfully interact and/or work with others to accomplish complex tasks, identify the dynamics present within diverse groups and use intercultural knowledge to strategically engage with other actors to enhance communities.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students will produce reflections about their experience within their groups based on thoughtful reflection and logs of their activities through the partner institution, and engage with the online iLearn community.

assessments.description: Students will produce a video wherein they discuss and reflect upon their experiences during the placement. The video should touch on an issue relating to what the student has learned, how they overcame challenges, how the experience related to their overall program of study, and the ways in which they will employ what they learned in the future study and/or community engagement. Additionally, students should discuss their preparation for the experience, and how this impacted their time at the host institution. The backup supplementary task for this assessment task is a diary discussing the experience.

Students are required to satisfactorily complete the components of their approved program of study. The backup supplementary task for this assessment task must be an equivalent program or experience, arranged by the student with the host institution.

data.subject_search_title: INTS3090 - International Studies Advanced In-Country Study 4

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit is offered on a pass/fail basis. This unit is designed for students interested in the cultures and languages offered in the Department of International Studies who wish to study at a partner university. A program of study at the overseas university must be worked out in advance in consultation with the Languages and Cultures Discipline staff, and approved by the Discipline Chair. Students will need to complete additional assessment through Macquarie University. Students planning to take this option should discuss their plans as early as possible with the unit's staff contact.
